question: It is important for children to learn the difference between right and wrong at an early age. Punishment is necessary to help them learn this distinction. To what extent do you agree or disagree? What sort of punishment should parents and teachers be allowed to use to teach good behavior to children? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
text: The language barrier is a major problem faced by people around the world when they try to get out of the box. Researches advocate that in the coming years humanity will have a common language to communicate. I consider this an advantageous development, and my reasoning is analysed in the ensuing paragraphs.

Firstly, there are numerous benefits followed by accepting a single language medium for the whole community. Initially, the exchange of ideas might not be a big deal, therefore individuals from varying cultural backgrounds and groups could flawlessly share useful information with the whole world. Primarily in the case of pandemics and catastrophes, a plethora of plausible measures might be derived from ancestors and grandfathers of different groups, which help to mitigate the detrimental effect that followed. For instance, even though Indian Tamilians knew the remedies to cure the plague in ancient days, it took almost a millennia to transfer the accurate details of the method to the outside world to decline the number of deaths. If the communication was better, the hazardous disease could have been eradicated easily.

Secondly, one language for the whole world not only helps people to go through different cultures but also let youngsters and enthusiasts to explore the world and human qualities without language discrimination. To make it more clear it opens a new door for explorers to fly overseas without a second thought and acquire the lifestyles and cultures adopted by different groups on mother earth. Moreover, a prime issue encountered by international students in a foreign country might be the negligence based on language, therefore that problem might not pop up. Another point to be considered is that, people from underdeveloped countries like Africa and Nigeria can easily find better employment opportunities without the language test and complexities of language.
To conclude, the same communication medium for all will be a great initiative that pave path to significant changes and potential benefits for people as well as the kingdom.

error_list.error_des: It appears that the word years should use the genitive case. Consider changing the noun.
It seems that the verb let does not agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
It appears that the verb to explore should be in the bare infinitive form. Consider removing to from in front of this verb.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma after the subordinating conjunction that. Consider removing the comma.
The plural verb pave does not appear to agree with the singular subject a great initiative. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The noun phrase path seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
